           <h1>
            <span itemprop="name">
             Shrimp Rice Paper Rolls Recipe
            </span>
           </h1>
           <hr/>
           <div class="row">
            <div class="column w6040">
             <div class="column ">
              <img border="0" src="http://www.bitememore.com/images/share.png" usemap="#Map"/>

             </div>

              <div style="float:left;">
               <div class="fb-like" data-href="http://www.bitememore.com/feedme/231/shrimp-rice-paper-rolls-recipe" data-layout="button_count" data-send="false" data-show-faces="false" data-width="450">

              <img src="http://www.bitememore.com/images/print.png"/>
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="row p20t">
            <meta content="http://www.bitememore.com/feedme/231/shrimp-rice-paper-rolls-recipe" itemprop="url"/>
            <img alt="Shrimp Rice Paper Rolls Recipe" class="w100 wBorder" itemprop="image" src="http://www.bitememore.com/media/feed/231_865410971_l.jpg" title="Shrimp Rice Paper Rolls Recipe"/>
           </div>
           <div class="row p20t">
            <span itemprop="description">
             It may be spring, but we're all about fresh summer rolls.  Forget the deep frying and opt for these refreshingly delicious, healthy  and impressive Shrimp Rice Paper Rolls.  Easy to make, Vietnamese rice paper is filled with a zesty shrimp salad, creamy avocado, crunchy vegetables and served with a wasabi dipping sauce.  Don't favor shrimp?  The possibilities for fillings are endless, everything from chicken and tofu to mango and cilantro.
             <br/>
             <br/>
             <br/>
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="row p20t">
            <div id="ingredients">
             <h3>
              Ingredients
             </h3>
             <br/>
             <span itemprop="ingredients">
              <span class="blurbTextBold">
               Zesty Shrimp Filling
              </span>
              <br/>
              <br/>
               cup mayonnaise
              <br/>
              1 tbsp chopped Italian flat leaf parsley
              <br/>
              2 tsp wasabi paste
              <br/>
              1 tsp soy sauce
              <br/>
              1 tsp fresh lime juice
              <br/>
               tsp lime zest
              <br/>
              8oz cooked shrimp, coarsely chopped
              <br/>
              <br/>
              6 round rice paper wrappers (8.5-inch diameter)
              <br/>
              <br/>
              6 romaine lettuce leaves
              <br/>
              1 large carrot, peeled and julienned
              <br/>
              1 cucumber, peeled and julienned
              <br/>
              1 avocado, thinly sliced
              <br/>
              2 tbsp chopped fresh basil
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span class="blurbTextBold">
               Wasabi Dipping Sauce
              </span>
              <br/>
              <br/>
               cup mayonnaise
              <br/>
              2 tsp soy sauce
              <br/>
              1 tsp wasabi paste
              <br/>
              1 tsp fresh lime juice
             </span>
            </div>
            <div id="bitemebit">
             <div id="biteme_bit">
              <span class="red">
               Bite
              </span>
              Me
              <span class="red">
               Bit
              </span>
             </div>
             <hr/>
             <div class="quote typewriter p30t p30b">
              "Large, naked raw carrots are acceptable as food only to those who lie in hutches eagerly awaiting Easter."
              <br/>
              <br/>
              -Fran Lebowitz
             </div>
             <hr/>
             <br/>
             <br/>
            </div>
            <div id="directions">
             <h3>
              Directions
             </h3>
             <br/>
             <span itemprop="recipeInstructions">
              <span class="redBold">
               1)
              </span>
              For the shrimp rice paper rolls, in a medium bowl, combine mayonnaise, parsley, wasabi paste, soy sauce, lime juice and lime zest.  Stir well to combine.  Add shrimp and mix together.  Place 1 rice paper sheet in a shallow bowl of hot water just until softened, about 1 minute.  Lay rice paper sheet on a damp tea towel.  Place lettuce leaf down the center of the rice sheet, leaving a 1-inch border at the top and bottom.  Place 2 heaping tablespoons of the shrimp mixture lengthwise on the lettuce leaf, followed by carrots, cucumber, avocado and a sprinkling of basil.  Fold up the bottom 1-inch border of rice paper placing it over the filling.  Fold in the right side, followed by the left side and then the top, forming a tight cylinder.  Repeat with remaining rice paper sheets and filling. Serve with dipping sauce.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span class="redBold">
               2)
              </span>
              For the dipping sauce, in small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, soy sauce, wasabi paste and lime juice.  Serve with rice paper rolls
              <br/>
              <br/>
              Yield: 6 rice paper rolls
             </span>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div id="printzone" style="display:none">

             1)
            </span>
            For the shrimp rice paper rolls, in a medium bowl, combine mayonnaise, parsley, wasabi paste, soy sauce, lime juice and lime zest.  Stir well to combine.  Add shrimp and mix together.  Place 1 rice paper sheet in a shallow bowl of hot water just until softened, about 1 minute.  Lay rice paper sheet on a damp tea towel.  Place lettuce leaf down the center of the rice sheet, leaving a 1-inch border at the top and bottom.  Place 2 heaping tablespoons of the shrimp mixture lengthwise on the lettuce leaf, followed by carrots, cucumber, avocado and a sprinkling of basil.  Fold up the bottom 1-inch border of rice paper placing it over the filling.  Fold in the right side, followed by the left side and then the top, forming a tight cylinder.  Repeat with remaining rice paper sheets and filling. Serve with dipping sauce.
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="redBold">
             2)
            </span>
            For the dipping sauce, in small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, soy sauce, wasabi paste and lime juice.  Serve with rice paper rolls
            <br/>
            <br/>
            Yield: 6 rice paper rolls
            <br/>
           </div>
